page.title: 02The Village of Harberton
page.content: The village consists of about 75 homes with a population of around 350 people. The houses mostly nestle in, or on the slopes of, the valley of a small stream. There is a Norman Church and a twelth century public house. Two large houses and their estates dominated village life and employment until comparatively recently. There are still two working farms within the village but today most residents travel outside the area to work. The population therefore tends to be young/middle aged as facilities are few for older people. Today a minority were actually born in the area. Even in the village farming is in evidence the cows walking in for milking are a familiar sight and they cannot help but make their mark.
